definition: (conjunction used to express contrast with a previous clause) but/then/standard/norm/principle/to imitate/to follow/classifier for written items

sentences.english: Such a mean fellow, though never so rich, should not be admitted into society.
sentences.chinese: 這樣卑鄙的人，雖則有錢，也應允許他進入社交界。

sentences.english: Though I'm a Chinese, I'll locate my story in Britain.
sentences.chinese: 雖則我是中國人，我將在不列顛找出我的故事。

sentences.english: Although I had a lot of thellongs to do, I felt uncomfortable.
sentences.chinese: 雖則我有很多工作要做，我覺得不舒服。

sentences.english: I don't take the time to tell you this often, but Ilove you, mom.
sentences.chinese: 雖則我經常沒有時候間告訴您，但我真的愛您，母親。

sentences.english: I don't take the time to tell you thellos often, but Ilove you, mom.
sentences.chinese: 雖則我時常沒有時候間告訴您，但我真的愛您，母親。

sentences.english: Though marriage makes man and wife one flesh, it leaves them still two fools.
sentences.chinese: 雖則結婚使夫妻合爲一體，但仍舊還不過是蠢人兩個。

sentences.english: She had no mosquito -net but there were two clean cotton quilts on bed.
sentences.chinese: 牀上雖則沒有帳子，但堆着有二條潔淨的青布被褥。

sentences.english: Though they talked in alow voice, they could be heard distinctly.
sentences.chinese: 雖則他們低聲談話，還是可以很清楚地聽見。

sentences.english: Much as I would like to help, I have a lot to do.
sentences.chinese: 雖則我渾如幫忙你，可是我有很多事要做。

sentences.english: It's in Tao Yuan county though, if you're interested msg me personally.
sentences.chinese: 它雖則在桃園縣，如果您感興趣的話可以寄信息我。
